results.title: Children learn from filmstrips
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Frank Spiller, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Illustrates the value of audio-visual instruction in primary schools. Children learn naturally about a subject such as the owl through visual presentation. Filmstrips help bring the world into the class-room. Various techniques for their use are suggested; silent run through for review, or a few frames at a time can be shown followed by discussion. Exercises, compositions and projects can be set afterwards to help reinforce what the children have learned.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Jackson, Frank Spiller, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB

results.title: Children in town
results.creator_credit: Centralfilm, Stockholm Parks Department and Radio Sweden
results.brief_description: Stockholm, a city of nearly a million inhabitants has made considerable progress in dealing with the problem of playgrounds for children living in urban areas. Over 160 large playgrounds, most of which have facilities for both indoor and outdoor games, have been provided.

results.title: Children in the hospital
results.creator_credit: M D, Edward Mason and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Describes through the experience of two young girls, the methods used in the pediatrics department of Boston City Hospital to alleviate the psychological burden of hospitalisation. Shows the varied reaction of the children and demonstrates the importance of adult assistance in reducing the pain and the disturbing consequences of hospitalisation.

results.title: Children crossing
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The patrol officer system in Tasmanian schools and its success in avoiding road accidents to children. Volunteers are trained by Road Safety Officers in supervising children at dangerous road crossings, on school buses and public transport. The status of school patrol officers and the extent of their authority.

results.title: Children at play
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Dentsu Tokyo and Koga Productions
results.brief_description: Between their studies, children of all ages and in all parts of Japan have time for fun and frolics. This film shows the games children play: on stilts, with hoops, in the snow, wrestling, ball games and shadow play and cats cradle. They also skip, play baseball, hopscotch, roller skating, shuttle cock, fly kites and model aeroplanes as well as painting, playing in sandpits, dressing dolls - and have a wonderful time in playgrounds.

results.title: Children are people (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lorna Ridgeway, Dan Douglas and Stockwell College of Education
results.brief_description: Shows a successful teaching experiment in primary schools in which classes are grouped vertically to include mixed ages, brothers and sisters. Explains how best children can be grouped and taught together so that they all enjoy school, learn effectively and develop their potential ability. Furthermore, it is claimed in the film that a more satisfactory social situation is created where social development is fostered to a greater degree than in single-age groups.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lorna Ridgeway, Dan Douglas and Stockwell College of Education

results.title: Children and the Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
This title explores some of the arts available to children as both participants and observers. Theatre, art and music are discussed by performers and parents. Producers and parents give their views on children’s radio and television and, finally, a parent explains the value and the process of parents telling stories to their children.
